title: Software Testing Competency Enhancement Education Through TPACK-Based Blended Teaching Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Situations requiring practice-centered educational design linked to real industrial settings. Requires project-based assessment systems considering learners' work applicability.

learning_goals: Learners can explain software testing theories (black-box/white-box testing, test design techniques, etc.) with an understanding of over 80%.
Learners can independently implement at least three test cases for real projects using automated testing tools such as JUnit/Selenium.
Learners can create defect reports and suggest improvements based on test result analysis.
Learners can propose at least two strategies for applying the seven knowledge domains of the TPACK framework (technology, content, pedagogy + four integrated domains) to testing education.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
